text: hi everyone big thingy drink tano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of the new slow
tie
album tyron this is the second
full-length commercial album from uk
songwriter and
rapper slow tie which arrives a few
years after his breakout debut
in 2019 nothing great about britain
which
instantly turned him into an artist to
watch thanks to its fusion of grime
hardcore hip hop and even punk
aesthetics not to mention tai's uniquely
nasal elastic and animated delivery
over the next year the more aggressive
songs in tai's catalog
combined with his live performances and
viral
antics would give him kind of a wild boy
reputation
something it seems he now wants to find
balance with
as tyron is presented in this two-disc
format though overall it is a relatively
short record at just 35 minutes
and there's a relatively strong
emotional separation between these two
batches of tracks
bouncy aggressive bangers with a trap
flare to kick things off at the start
then a run of despondent diatribes with
names like mount kimby james blake
and dominic fike adding to the emotional
nuance of the record
on his last lp i think slow tai already
did a pretty good job of
making these two sides of himself very
clear but now it seems he wants
listeners to
really feel and see the difference and i
surely did for
better or for worse because in the
process of almost
pitting these two vibes against each
other
one does outshine the other and what
side that is maybe depends on your
personality
or what drew you to slow ties music in
the first place
for me there is one collection of tracks
here that
surpasses in terms of lyrical detail and
emotional impact and it's not the first
don't get me wrong songs like what as
well as vex are
fantastically grimy almost like a
demented version of something
that you would get on an asap rocky
record but neither
offer much in terms of structure or
variation there are standouts on the
first
disc and they're basically the most
developed songs here
the hard-hitting maza featuring asap
rocky
which almost sounds like tai's take on a
playboy cardi song
spitting bullets and weird ad-libs over
a bear trap beat and deceptively simple
weary dusty wheezing cords
ty even hits a little baby voiced
inflection for a moment during the
addictive hook
rocky also does not skimp on his guest
verse
that molotov and mazel tov line was fire
as well as the way he passes off to slow
tie at the back end of his verse
slow tai hear your part go then there's
cancelled featuring skepta which also
hits hard
features a sharp hook creative beat
switch and a lyrical focus on
essentially being uncancelable however i
would be lying if i didn't point out
that much of the shine on this track
does
go to skepta especially with that few
g's killing them softly line
overall it's a good track just slow tie
doesn't give himself enough time to
really leave
an impression on it then we have the
vulnerable final track on the first
disc play with fire which is not quite
as hard or aggressive
as anything else on this section of the
record the reason being i think this one
feels more like a transitional moment
slow tie begins getting in his feelings
which i think prepares us for
the emotional rigor of the second disc
it's like the whole record starts off on
this euphoric or aggressive high that
slow tie eventually comes down from
especially around the track dead where
things get a bit more spacey
and morbid and existential then play
with fire presents
slow ties negative thoughts creeping in
affecting him
which happens against these plucky
sparkling lead melodies
steady beats distant vocal samples ties
passionate delivery is great and only
intensifies his bars
about mental health effectively painting
this picture of a
binge and crash cycle describing his
bike as having no brakes
which eventually puts him in a dark and
remorseful place that he can't escape
with the second disc things turn
instantly cinematic on the song i tried
where the instrumental features these
idyllic pitched
warped soul samples that feel like a
combination of kanye west
but also tyler the creator this sound
serves as a perfect bed for slow ty's
vivid lyrics about
being treated like a pest tumbling down
a black hole
broken homes he comes off so devastated
and confident at the same time he is
truly reveling in his underdog status
the following focus extends a lot of
these same feelings
but trying to give the audience a sense
of
reframing its mind in order to not
have the negativity that the past couple
of tracks have been about
preoccupying things so much not crazy
about the instrumental
and some of slow ties rhyme schemes are
incredibly basic here but i do
appreciate how frankie comes across on
this one
we have a stronger lyrical and
instrumental showing in my opinion on
the following track terms which features
a very strong hook from dominic fike
what slow tie says on this track in my
opinion hits even harder as he is
rapping about
mitigating his own madness being caught
in a cycle of drugs and sadness and
having a hard time just climbing out of
it
the acoustic and melancholy instrumental
along with dead never's touching lead
vocals
on the song push are a nice contrast
from slow tie's really intense and manic
delivery
along with his bars about persevering
then from here on tyron we move into a
strong final leg
starting with nhs laced with these
squeaky
little lead vocals that are so
brockhampton all the way
i guess you could say this is the
record's closest attempt at a happy song
there's even an aside in the midst of
the track where slow tie says this is a
[ __ ] happy song
where he's essentially trying to see the
good in the bad
in a way what is beauty without chaos
what is positivity without negativity
i think the song is a great attempt on
slow ty's part to deliver the audience
some kind of
assurance for us but also for him
because when you do listen to this
record for a while you you really do
begin to
worry for the guy in a way things turn a
bit more grim
on the following feel away now while the
instrumental on this track with its
delayed chords and
stunning guest vocal from james blake i
mean it's beautiful
but simultaneously do notice that the
entire track is about
essentially this relationship folding
crumbling because of the inadequacies of
the two individuals
involved in it specifically slotai who
at this point feels like
his shortcomings just aren't allowing
him to
continue forward it's really one of
those cliched
it's not you it's me type moments but
you really do feel it
then adhd i found to be a fitting closer
and a little shocking at some parts and
also a cliffhanger slow tie is obviously
struggling with the mental demons that
put
us on the tyrant journey to begin with
the depression of this record and the
anger
of this record are coalescing in a way
and meeting at this just enraged climax
the refrains of the tracks start putting
in our heads this idea that slow tie is
going to take his life
the song cuts off and then it moves into
a phone call
with someone who sounds like his brother
at least he's referring to
him as such and it's like slow tai goes
to the ledge
he's in the supremely dark place but
then connecting with someone who's
important to him allows him to back off
reframe and think about what really
matters then as he circumvents
this attempt on his own life he comes
back with like even more
force than ever and is almost like
daring about the whole thing i mean the
final
bar on the track is fail to exit like
you know he doesn't have a visa
a choice that i hope slow tai continues
to make no matter where his demons put
him
so yes overall i thought this was a
strong showing for slow tai
conceptually and creatively because i
think this record is a lot more about
the journey than it is any individual
track
and i can't really say i'm surprised
about the themes of this album either
because slotai's last lp in many
respects was
very much a mental health record and he
focuses successfully on
that idea even more here yeah there were
a few spots on the front end i found to
be a little underwhelming
under structured underproduced but not
really anything that derailed the record
overall or took away from the incredible
run of tracks
in the second half feeling a light to
decent eight on
